dmca.title: FYIO: Dubai Forums - For the attention of the Managing Director]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net
[mailto:colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net] 
Sent: Friday, February 09, 2007 1:39 AM
To: Legal Response
Subject: FYIO: Dubai Forums - For the attention of the Managing
Director]

Dear Sir

May I please have the courtesy of a reply to my earlier e-mail below?

Regards
Colin Barr

----- Forwarded message from colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net -----
     Date: Sat, 03 Feb 2007 23:31:36 -0800
     From: colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net
Reply-To: colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net
  Subject: Re: FW: [Fwd: FW: FW: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums -  
For the attentionoftheManaging Director]
       To: Legal Response <LegalResponse@theplanet.com>

Dear Sirs

Please see below.  By the 17th November the owner of Dubai Forums had
removed all entries.  However, please see attached which has now
re-appeared on the site but they are the same old postings that had
been removed.

We require them to be removed within the next 3 working days otherwise
we will re instruct our USA lawyers to re commence proceedings against
you and once again have them contact Google.  Note: last time round
Google were notified and ADWORDS had filed an enquiry since the site
was using Google Adwords.

We await your immediate response.

Yours faithfully
Colin Barr
Heathcrest Legal Consultants

Quoting Legal Response <LegalResponse@theplanet.com>:

>  fyi...
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: support@royalwebhosting.com [mailto:support@royalwebhosting.com]
> Posted At: Tuesday, November 14, 2006 4:21 PM
> Posted To: Legal Response
> Conversation: [Fwd: FW: FW: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For
the
> attentionoftheManaging Director]
> Subject: Re: [Fwd: FW: FW: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For the
> attentionoftheManaging Director]
>
>
> Hello The,
>
> We've contacted the owner of dubaiforums.com and asked him to handle
> this, he said that he will remove most of unverifiable information,
but
> he will not remove everything about this company.
>
>
>
> TPLRT> -----Original Message-----
> TPLRT> From: colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net
> TPLRT> [mailto:colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net]
> TPLRT> Posted At: Saturday, November 11, 2006 11:30 PM Posted To:
> TPLRT> Copyright
> TPLRT> Conversation: FW: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For the
> TPLRT> attentionoftheManaging Director
> TPLRT> Subject: Re: FW: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For the
> TPLRT> attentionoftheManaging Director
>
>
> TPLRT> Dear Andrea
>
> TPLRT> We need your written confirmation by close of business Monday
> TPLRT> 13th November that posting will be removed from Dubai Forums
site
>
> TPLRT> or we will instruct lawyers to proceed with action against you.
>
> TPLRT> Yours sincerely
> TPLRT> Heathcrest Legal Consultants
>
> TPLRT> Quoting colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net:
>
>>> Dear Andrea,
>>>
>>> many thanks for your time and consideration. If you look at the
>>> postings as per our very first email to you, the postings contain
>>> allegations that if true would amount to criminal acts by PIC in
>>> Dubai
>
>>> ie
>>>
>>> 1. not been licensed
>>> 2. Cold Calling
>>> 3. Accusations relating to business practices not been honest etc
etc
>
>>> as previosly laid out to you.
>>>
>>> All of these accusations are untrue, amount to libel and you are of
>>> course responsible for the content of your site.
>>>
>>> Our USA lawyers have looked at all this and have confirmed that in
>>> their opinion the matter falls within the Communications Decency
Act.
>>> In fact, they were lead counsel in Schneider v. Amazon (one of the
>>> first cases decided under the CDA).  Also For instance, a California
>>> state court of appeals has adopted a view of the CDA, emphasizing
>>> that
>
>>> the statute shouldn?t be read to protect those with guilty knowledge
>>> of the libelous content. Barrett v. Rosenthal, ?- Cal.Rptr.3d ??,
>>> 2003
>
>>> WL 22346578 (?We agree with appellants that the statute cannot be
>>> deemed to abrogate the common law principle that one who republishes
>>> defamatory matter originated by a third person is subject to
>>> liability
>
>>> if he or she knows or has reason to know of its defamatory
>>> character.?), which clearly suggeststhere should be liability for
>>> leaving something online once you have reason to know it?s
> defamatory.
>>>
>>> Now i have cleared this up for you please confirm removal by return?
>>> We thank you in anticipation of your co-operation.
>>>
>>> yours faithfully
>>>
>>> Heathcrest Legal Consultants Ltd
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> uoting Copyright <Copyright@theplanet.com>:
>>>
>>>> Please articulate your complaint since I am unable to understand
>>>> what
>
>>>> are you complaining about. You are welcome to give me a call at
your
>
>>>> earliest convenience at (214)782-7771.
>>>>
>>>> Thank you,
>>>> Andrea
>>>>
>>>> -----Original Message-----
>>>> From: colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net
>>>> [mailto:colin.barr@heathcrestlegal.net]
>>>> Posted At: Tuesday, November 07, 2006 9:22 PM Posted To: Copyright
>>>> Conversation: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For the attention
>>>> oftheManaging Director
>>>> Subject: RE: [EV1-C1623693C] Fwd: Dubai Forums - For the attention
>>>> oftheManaging Director
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> We replied to thuis yesterday as best we could. Please see below.
It
>
>>>> appears that generally emailing you just results in a standard
reply
>
>>>> re copyright. This is not a copyright issue. We must now have your
>>>> confirmation of removal by return or we will have to request our
USA
>
>>>> lawyers to issue proceedings against you.
>>>>
>>>> yours faithfully
>>>>
>>>> Heathcrestlegal Consultants
>>>>
>>>> Dear Sirs, further to our earlier exchange of emails today re
>>>> libelous postings [see below] Also [re the URL request] below is
the
>
>>>> appropriate detail for you to track it from the site.
>>>>
>>>> Please now confirm removal by return to avoid the court action.
>>>>
>>>> yours faithfully
>>>>
>>>> Heathcrestlegal Consultants Ltd
>>>>
>>>> Hi Colin,
>>>>
>>>> Please start off with the below... I'm sure they'll find the thread
>>>> that way.
>>>>
>>>> Regards
>>>>
>>>> Bev
>>>>
>>>> Hello Bev,
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> I found 1 post and it had 3 pages. Where there more on dubai
forums?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>

>>>>

>>>> Ivan Ciancio
